div.head: CAP. V
Concerning the institution of baptism
div.p: Concerning the institution of baptism, namely when it began, there are various opinions.

Some say that baptism was instituted, when Christ said to Nicodemus:
Unless one is born again, from water and the Holy Spirit
Iohannes 3:5 .

Other says that the institution of baptism was made, when he said to the Apostles Alii dicunt institutionem baptismi factam, cum Apostolis dixit:
Go, teaching all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit
Matthaeus 28:19 . But he said this to them after the resurrection, instructing them about the calling of the gentiles, who before his passions he sent out two by two to preach in Judea and to baptize, saying:
Do not go amount the gentiles
Matthaeus 10:5 . Therefore by this time baptism was already instituted because they were baptizing and preaching.

But if it is asked, in what form they baptized at that time, it is soundly able to be said: in the name of the Trinity, namely in this form, in which they later baptized the gentiles; which, it is able to be understood, was passed down before the passion, though it was not yet written. Therefore at that time Christ did not give this form for the first time, when he sent them to evangelize the gentiles; but what he gave before, when sending them to the Jews, he repeated again, when he sent them to the gentiles.

Therefore it is better said that the institution was made, when Christ was baptized by John in the Jordan; we he ordered, not because he wished to be made clean, since he was without sin, but because
with the contact of his clean body he brings to the water a regenerative power
XXX , such that whoever would be immersed afterward, with the name of Trinity invoked, would be cleansed from sin. Therefore, the baptism of Christ was instituted at that time, in which the Trinity, the mystery of which is made known through it, internally baptized man.
